sheep.collision
Class QuadTree

java.lang.Object
  sheep.collision.QuadTree
All Implemented Interfaces:
Spatial
public class QuadTree
extends java.lang.Object
implements Spatial

A QuadTree is a way of dividing the game scene into quadrants recursively. By putting sprites into the lower levels nodes of the tree, one can exclude iteration of far away sprites during collision detection.

Constructor Summary
QuadTree(float xmin, float xmax, float ymin, float ymax, int depth)
          Creates a new QuadTree with the given boundaries and recursion depth.
QuadTree(float width, float height, int depth)
          Creates a new QuadTree with boundaries x = [-width, width], and y = [-height, height].
QuadTree(QuadTree tree)
          Creates a new QuadTree using the boundaries and depth of the old quad tree.

Creates a new QuadTree using the boundaries and depth of the old quad tree.

QuadTree

public QuadTree(float width,
                float height,
                int depth)
Creates a new QuadTree with boundaries x = [-width, width], and y = [-height, height].

Parameters:
width - The half-width of the world.
height - The half-height of the world.
depth - The number of recursion steps.

QuadTree

public QuadTree(float xmin,
                float xmax,
                float ymin,
                float ymax,
                int depth)
Creates a new QuadTree with the given boundaries and recursion depth.

Parameters:
xmin - The lower boundary on the x-axis.
xmax - The upper boundary on the x-axis.
ymin - The lower boundary on the y-axis.
ymax - The upper boundary on the y-axis.
depth - The number of recursion steps.
Method Detail

add

public void add(java.util.LinkedList<Sprite> list)
Adds a sprite list to the lists of sprite lists. The list of sprite lists is used to clear the quadtree quickly.

Parameters:
list - The list to add to the "list of lists".

insert

public void insert(Sprite sprite)
Description copied from interface: Spatial
Inserts a Sprite into the structure. How a Sprite is inserted is up the subclass, and may be based on information found in the Sprite, like its BoundingBox.

Specified by:
insert in interface Spatial
Parameters:
sprite - The Sprite to insert.

clear

public void clear()
Description copied from interface: Spatial
Clears all sprites from the structure. When rebuilding the structure, it is usually more efficient to clear the elements than to reallocate the entire structure.

Specified by:
clear in interface Spatial
